overview: Grainne Barron, CEO of foxframe, is a media industry professional (production and commercial) with more than 15 years (Europe & USA) experience in traditional video advertising and digital media coupled with board level technical and sales expertise. Grainne has spent 10+ years in senior management roles in the television, video and digital production industry and has worked with NBC New York, NBC California and was Sales Director with Windmill Lane Studios. Grainne was one of ten finalists selected from over 500 applicants to participate in the first Endeavour incubator program in 2010. She serves on a subcommittee for the Broadcasting Association of Ireland and is a Non Executive Director of The Yunus Movie Projectâ€”an internationally backed film about Muhammad Yunus. Grainne has an MBA from UCD and a BS in Business Management from Fordham University. In 2011 Grainne Barron won the PwC Award for Best Investor Proposal at the PwC Docklands Innovation Awards.

milestones.description: Minister of Enterprise announces funding for 24 technology startups.
CEO of foxframe.com beats tough competition to win PwC Best Investor Proposal at Docklands Innovation Awards.
milestones.source_description: CEO of Foxframe wins Innovation Award
